message: My question for you guys is, should I continue to develop this project or start something new?

I've been working on Meetifyr for about a year and its getting a steady number of users (around 4k a month).  I don't think its ever going to set the world alight but its been very rewarding and a good learning experience.
So what do you think, should I keep pounding away with this idea or focus on something new?

I've got ideas to take Meetifyr further, link to Facebook/Twitter accounts, email invites/alerts and I do think there's room for improvement in this space - easy scheduling for friends.  However I do have other ideas and wouldn't mind starting something new on a different technology stack (Google App Engine, Scala and Lift as opposed to GAE, Python and Django currently) to brorden my skills.

So do you know why you aren't getting more people use Meetifyr? Is it just the discovery problem? 4k new users per mth is pretty good and the nature of your app has the viral since 1 new user would invite friends to join from events.. etc... are invited friends required to sign up? if not can you make a simple fb connect to do that?
@shutton btw great job on the UI on http://www.meetifyr.com/example i like how easy it is to add and toggle names/etc
Maybe links to FB and or Twitter would help with this...
thanks.  To clarify, its 4k users total per month and only increasing by a few hundred per month.
I'd like to think its a discovery problem but I've not seen much of the viral effect you suggest (and I thought) a site like this would generate.
@appdk thanks for the bug report, what browser was that with?
@shutton oic... what about invited users? do they return to use the site for their own event? are you tracking that?
@shutton there is a bug when i create a new event. it did not show the free/not free buttons for each guest, and i had to reload the page to get that to show
I'm not really tracking that and since there's no login I don't know who's new and who's returning
